# Fastp 

To run Fastp, go to Tools and Type in "Fastp"

Then select these options: 

1.  Single-end or Paired-end reads?: Single end
    -  Choose the Porechop results as your input  
2.  In "Adapter Trimming Options”
    -  “Disable adapter trimming”: yes
3.  In "Filter Options”
    - In Quality Filter options: 
        - “Qualified quality phred”: 9
    - In “Length filtering options”:
        - “Length required”: 1000
        - “Maximum length”: 2000
4. In “Read Modification Options”:
    - “PolyG tail trimming”: Disable polyG tail trimming

After Fastp has run, it will generate: 
  
- fastp on collection: Read 1 output - The filtered reads, which we will use in the next step 
- fastp on collection: HTML Report: A report showing you how many reads were filtered
- fastp on collection: JSON report: A report in a different format, showing you how many reads were filtered 

![GIF of setting up CutAdapt](/GIFs/Fastp.gif)

Now we can do our quality control steps again to assess the processed reads.
